meta.title: Caliphate
meta.description:
In the war on terror, who is it that we’re really fighting? “Caliphate” follows Rukmini Callimachi, who covers terrorism for The New York Times, on her quest to understand ISIS. For more information about the series, visit nytimes.com/caliphate. This series includes disturbing language and scenes of graphic violence.

Producer: Andy Mills; Reporters: Rukmini Callimachi and Andy Mills; Managing Producer: Larissa Anderson; Editors: Wendy Dorr and Larissa Anderson; Associate Producer: Asthaa Chaturvedi; Technical Director: Brad Fisher; Executive Producer, NYT Audio: Lisa Tobin; Editorial Director, NYT Audio: Samantha Henig; Assistant Managing Editor, NYT: Sam Dolnick; Music: William Brittelle, Andy Mills, Nate Henricks, Cliff Martinez, Brad Fisher, Taku Sugimoto and David Wingo
meta.author: The New York Times

episodes.title: Chapter Ten: One Year Later
episodes.description: What does the future hold for the ISIS returnee who confessed to murder? And what does he believe now?

episodes.title: Chapter Nine: Prisoners, Part One
episodes.description: Slavery was enmeshed in the theology of ISIS. Rukmini speaks to an ISIS detainee who challenges her to find the girl he enslaved. She does.

episodes.title: Chapter Nine: Prisoners, Part Two
episodes.description: After three years in ISIS captivity, a young Yazidi girl returns to her family. Rukmini is there to witness it.

episodes.title: Chapter Eight: The Briefcase
episodes.description: We found a trove of secret documents after Mosul fell. It led us to the mother of an ISIS official.

episodes.title: Chapter Seven: Mosul
episodes.description: What did ISIS leave behind as their hold on Mosul crumbled?

episodes.title: Chapter Six: Paper Trail
episodes.description: “Something was off.” Rukmini’s doubt fuels a quest to uncover the truth.

episodes.title: Chapter Five: The Heart
episodes.description: The recruit carried out the killing. Then he questioned everything.

episodes.title: Chapter Four: Us vs. Them
episodes.description: A new recruit proves his worth and gets invited to a secret meeting.

episodes.title: Chapter Three: The Arrival
episodes.description: ISIS turns fantasy into reality for a new recruit.

episodes.title: Chapter Two: Recruitment
episodes.description: Who is it that ISIS appeals to, and how? Rukmini speaks with a former ISIS member about how and why he joined the fold.

episodes.title: Chapter One: The Reporter
episodes.description: Rukmini describes the reality of being on the terrorism beat and why she brings trash bags with her to the frontlines of the war against ISIS.

episodes.title: Prologue: The Mission
episodes.description: The war on terror has cost the U.S. billions and has been fought for nearly 20 years. Rukmini Callimachi, a foreign correspondent for The New York Times, asks, “Who are we really fighting?”
